Description: Fragment of lip and wall (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-glazed pottery cup (type C); lip concave with sharp carination at shoulder; wholly glazed; inscription cut on the outside.
Curator's comments: See A. Scholtz, Aphrodite Pandemos at Naukratis, GRBS 43 (2002-3) 231. The fragment nearly joins 1965,0930.758, on which the final letters (as recorded by Gardner) can be seen, the iota clearly, the omega only in part in the break. 212 pencilled on interior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 821, pl. XXI)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 689, no. 470, pl. 22.2.7)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p. 16, fig. 17, 18; no. 60, 85)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1604)
